00020 /*****************************************************************************
00021 
00022   sc_uint.h -- An unsigned integer whose length is less than 64 bits.
00023 
00024                Unlike arbitrary precision, arithmetic and bitwise operations
00025                are performed using the native types (hence capped at 64 bits).
00026                The sc_uint integer is useful when the user does not need
00027                arbitrary precision and the performance is superior to
00028                sc_bigint/sc_biguint.
00029 
00030   Original Author: Amit Rao, Synopsys, Inc.
00031 
00032  *****************************************************************************/
00033 
00034 /*****************************************************************************
00035 
00036   MODIFICATION LOG - modifiers, enter your name, affiliation, date and
00037   changes you are making here.
00038 
00039       Name, Affiliation, Date: Ali Dasdan, Synopsys, Inc.
00040   Description of Modification: - Resolved ambiguity with sc_(un)signed.
00041                                - Merged the code for 64- and 32-bit versions
00042                                  via the constants in sc_nbdefs.h.
00043                                - Eliminated redundant file inclusions.
00044 
00045       Name, Affiliation, Date:
00046   Description of Modification:
00047 
00048  *****************************************************************************/
00049

00062 #ifndef SC_UINT_H
00063 #define SC_UINT_H
00064 
00065 
00066 #include "sysc/datatypes/int/sc_uint_base.h"

00069 namespace sc_dt

00072 // classes defined in this module
00073 template <int W> class sc_uint;
00074 
00075 
00076 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00077 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_uint<W>
00078 //
00079 //  Template class sc_uint<W> is the interface that the user sees. It
00080 //  is derived from sc_uint_base and most of its methods are just
00081 //  wrappers that call the corresponding method in the parent
00082 //  class. Note that the length of sc_uint datatype is specified as a
00083 //  template parameter.
00084 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00085 
00086 template <int W>
00087 class sc_uint
00088     : public sc_uint_base
00089 {
00090 public:
00091 
00092     // constructors
00093 
00094     sc_uint()
00095         : sc_uint_base( W )
00096         {}
00097 
00098     sc_uint( uint_type v )
00099         : sc_uint_base( v, W )
00100         {}
00101 
00102     sc_uint( const sc_uint<W>& a )
00103         : sc_uint_base( a )
00104         {}
00105 
00106     sc_uint( const sc_uint_base& a )
00107         : sc_uint_base( W )
00108         { sc_uint_base::operator = ( a ); }
00109 
00110     sc_uint( const sc_uint_subref_r& a )
00111         : sc_uint_base( W )
00112         { sc_uint_base::operator = ( a ); }
00113 
00114     template< class T >
00115     sc_uint( const sc_generic_base<T>& a )
00116         : sc_uint_base( W )
00117         { sc_uint_base::operator = ( a ); }
00118 
00119     sc_uint( const sc_signed& a )

00196         { m_val = a.m_val; return *this; }

00281 
00282     sc_uint<W>& operator <<= ( uint_type v )

00287 
00288 
00289     // prefix and postfix increment and decrement operators
00290 
00291     sc_uint<W>& operator ++ () // prefix
00292         { sc_uint_base::operator ++ (); return *this; }
00293 
00294     const sc_uint<W> operator ++ ( int ) // postfix
00295         { return sc_uint<W>( sc_uint_base::operator ++ ( 0 ) ); }
00296 
00297     sc_uint<W>& operator -- () // prefix
00298         { sc_uint_base::operator -- (); return *this; }
00299 
00300     const sc_uint<W> operator -- ( int ) // postfix
00301         { return sc_uint<W>( sc_uint_base::operator -- ( 0 ) ); }
